text:
Did the regex validation for Display Conditions in Custom Modules recently change? One of mine that was working fine just a few hours ago is now showing as invalid and I'm unable to save the module. I'm not an expert with regex so I'm not sure if what I previously had was wrong, but all I'm trying to do is figure out the correct syntax for a Display Condition when the value matches one of a list of values and also the syntax for when the value matches none of a list of values. Previously I was using these and they worked perfectly, but now I just get an error:
^(?=value1|value2)
^(?!value1|value2)
I’m getting regex errors now too
in a module that had a form, suddenly this appeared `^((?!\"form_type\":\"TICKET_FORM\").)*$` in the form field
I had to remove that to make it so i could publish my module

yes we recently updated our regex library. unfortunately, this new library doesn't have exact parity with the old library, so some previously valid regexes will now be considered invalid and will need to be updated
<@UEKMY50SU> That sounds like an issue, but if that's how the update is going to be handled is there at least any documentation on what the syntax should look like with this new library?

<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YH119N2/p1556149576106100> just wanted to re-ping, specifically using HubL request.IP to then interact with smart modules—any tips on where to look/who to talk to/hire?
Hi, anyone know if I can push items to array in hubl
Just a warning, that data isn't super-reliable, especially for IPv6 addresses.

building an event listing. trying to only display events that have not ended yet. events in the HubDB are stored as Date and Time Columns.

Here’s my code:
```
{%- set newOld = "gte" -%}
{%- set eventList = hubdb_table_rows(module.hubdb_table, "end_date__"+newOld+"=" ~ unixtimestamp(today("America/New_York")) ~ "&orderBy=start_date") -%}
```

anyone know why based on that, events set for say 9pm tonight, would not be displayed?
for some context, if I set the event to end tomorrow, the event displays. If I set the event to end yesterday it is hidden. This issue only occurs on the end date of the event

Hey there,

I have created a table of contents module, and when editing a blog post, I insert the module snippet inside the blog post body module with the source code editor.

It does work but is it supported? Should this be done some other way?
